Forgotten Louvre security report highlighted specific balcony used by crown jewel thieves
subhead: Le Monde has learned that a 2018 security audit explicitly identified the balcony used by the thieves as a point of vulnerability, even noting the possibility that a freight lift could be used to access it.

When a Syrian author becomes the voice of Gaza's survivors
subhead: 'A Memory of Annihilation,' the latest book by Samar Yazbek, brings together a striking series of testimonies from survivors of the hell in Gaza.

title: The overlooked issue of domestic violence against elderly women
subhead: Among all women killed by their partners in France in 2024, 26% were over the age of 70, a figure that is on the rise. Yet, the murders of these women and the possible abuse that preceded them are poorly documented.

title: Previously unknown Renoir painting sells for €1.8 million at auction
subhead: The oil painting by French impressionist painter August Renoir of his toddler son Jean had never before been exhibited or sold. The high-end art market has been experiencing a recent boon, with record-breaking sales in the past week alone for works by Frida Kahlo and Gustav Klimt.

title: Boualem Sansal: 'At my age, I am not about to learn to hold my tongue...'
subhead: The French-Algerian writer, who has been in France since November 18, has regained his freedom, including his freedom of speech. He recounts his yearlong detention in Algeria, discusses the remarks that led to his arrest, and reflects on the future of relations between France and Algeria.

title: Fiona Hill: 'The US is giving Russia tremendous influence over Europe'
subhead: According to the former Trump adviser, 'This White House wants Ukraine to capitulate to Russian demands to end this war, without proper consideration of all the factors at play.'

title: France's cultural landmarks enter a time of costly makeovers
subhead: Lack of regular upkeep and the effects of climate change have forced many cultural institutions to undertake massive renovation projects, with costs expected to reach €5 billion over the next 10 years.
